definition: mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: The babies died after an apparent mistake involving a drug they were receiving.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿们很明显是死于医生们错用的药物。

sentences.english: Finally, the misapplication of the model is indicated.
sentences.chinese: 最后指出模型的误用与错用问题。

sentences.english: Is he likely to ring today?
sentences.chinese: 他今天是否可能打捉错用神电话来？

sentences.english: This writer really fractures the language.
sentences.chinese: 这位作家确实错用了语言。

definition: to falsely believe/to be mislead/to fall for (a trick etc)
lit. to put Zhang's hat on Li's head/to attribute sth to the wrong person (idiom)/to confuse one thing with another
to affect adversely/to delay or hinder/to waste (an opportunity)/to mislead
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
to listen to information/to get the news/to believe what one hears
lit. to steal a rafter and replace it with a column/to replace the original with a fake/to perpetrate a fraud (idiom)
